monogr.author: Niccols, Richard

div.head: To the Reader.
div.p: GEntlewomen) this last and least part of my litle labour, I consecrate to you, the image of whose honour, though so excellent, that like that part of the picture of Venus left to posteritie by Apelles, takes away all hope of imitating the same; Yet to acquit my selfe of that madnesse, which the woman-hater doth indeuour to make mine, perhaps though more hastily then happily, I haue here cast off this image of Honour from the model of a woman, in honour of your sex. To answer those, that say, my pen drops gall against you in the first part, I desire you to know that my Furies touch none but those Apes of yours; such I meane, who making no difference betw • xt Swans and Geesse; because they haue both white feathers, imitate only your fashion not your vertues. If in what followes you find my stile too harsh for so sweet a subiect, my forme too impolish for so faire an image, be pleased to know that I am limited to Epigrams, in which no pen can limme so faire a picture as your faire deserues; such as it is; if you respect it, I care not who reiect it, for, I put my selfe vnder your protection.
